alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Moffat County through 400 PM MDT... At 328 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Rangely, or 48 miles east of Vernal, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Moffat County, including the following locations... Massadona and Elk Springs. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 14 and 40. Colorado 64 between mile markers 28 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
